Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored two goals, bringing his total to 108 international goals, tying him with Ali Daei for second place behind Cristiano Ronaldo
Lautaro Martinez scored Argentina's second goal from a penalty in the 39th minute
Lionel Messi assisted Lautaro Martinez for Argentina's third goal in the 66th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina can now shift their full focus to defending their title in the upcoming Copa America
Lionel Scaloni emphasized that Messi would play the full 90 minutes against Guatemala
Inter Milanâ€™s Lautaro Martinez scored his first penalty for the national team
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi praised Lautaro Martinez for taking the penalty and thanked him for the gesture
Lautaro Martinez complimented 19-year-old Valentin Carboni, noting his growth and potential
Lionel Scaloni will need to address the early own goal before facing Canada in the Copa America
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Commanders Field in Maryland with a crowd of 51,713
Valentin Carboni, a 19-year-old, was given a start in place of Di Maria
